<denchmark-link:https://github.com/InCogNiTo124>@InCogNiTo124</denchmark-link> This is not the same issue.

I think the problem is kfctl is not properly handling the fact that deleting the namespace will return an error if K8s is currently trying to delete the objects in the namespace <denchmark-code>couldn't delete KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Delete failed for ksonnet: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: couldn't delete namespace kubeflow Error: Operation cannot be fulfilled on namespaces "kubeflow": The system is ensuring all content is removed from this namespace. Upon completion, this namespace will automatically be purged by the system. </denchmark-code>
We probably need to fix the kfctl logic to properly handle this better. The original issue was reporting a problem with kfctl 0.5. since it was using ksonnet. I suspect the problem exists in 0.6 as well and we should try to fix as part of the 0.7 release or sooner if possible. /cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kkasravi>@kkasravi</denchmark-link>

We should probably update the test as well to verify it works as intended <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/testing/kfctl/kfctl_delete_test.py>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/master/testing/kfctl/kfctl_delete_test.py</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kkasravi>@kkasravi</denchmark-link>
How should we handle this? Some thoughts are:
Wait for Kubeflow namespace to be deleted before proceeding with Resource deletion. Check the error and catch the specific scenario. Not sure how we would do this other than checking for the error message inside the error, which seems brittle.

hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> - welcome back! 2 approaches that I can think of:
use labels - similar to what we did in 0.5. The reason why we're breaking now is we have many applications and we no longer have a global label. We need to create instance labels per application and could delete all resources which carry the same app.kubernetes.io/part-of label. This would include istio namespace and profile namespaces.
the application-controller will insert owner-refs of resources it thinks it owns. This isn't comprehensive right now but would allow easier cascaded deletes if the ApplicationCR is deleted.
I think we need to (as Jeremy suggests) - have an e2e test for this. I've been working on e2e so I hope to have something this week for this.
